metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6124 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A casting error in Chicken before 4.8.0 on 64-bit platform caused therandom number generator to return a constant value. NOTE: the vendor states"This function wasn't used for security purposes (and is advertised asbeing unsuitable)."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chicken-bin - 4.8.0-1
libchicken7 - 4.8.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chicken package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-1').
